results.title: The Cancer gas
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Vinyl chloride monomer is a gas used in the making of PVC - one of the most common forms of plastic. Scientists now believe that workmen breathing the fumes of VCM can contract cancer of the liver.

results.title: Cancer by the carton
results.creator_credit: Harry R Smith, Leston Post and International Temperance Association
results.brief_description: The relationship between cigarette-smoking and lung cancer. Leading US surgeons and health authorities emphasise the parallel between increased smoking in recent decades and higher incidence of lung cancer. Also stressed is the shorter life of cigarette-smokers. The film dramatizes the story of a (fictitious) editor, who is trying to persuade the Board of a US magazine to publish the facts on cancer. Includes scenes of an actual lung operation, and of the diseased lung after removal.

results.title: Cancer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
Discusses the nature of cancer cells, and how they are identified. Stresses the importance of early diagnosis and prompt treatment in the cure of many cases. Shows the method of self-examination of the breasts; emphasises the need for women to have regular cell tests for uterine cancer; and the value of regular chest X-rays. Shows the work done by the Anti-Cancer Council of Victoria, the Cytology Service at Prince Henry’s Hospital and the Peter MacCallum Clinic.

results.title: Canberra today and tomorrow
results.brief_description: The rapidly developing capital city of Australia. Its beautiful site and many parks and gardens; national traditions enshrined in the Australian War Memorial, the Royal Military College of Duntroon and in Parliament House. The diplomatic missions, Canberra University College, research institutions. The corporate life of the city and plans for its future.
results.description: The rapidly developing capital city of Australia. results.title: The Canberra Lake: Springtime sixty-four
results.creator_credit: Neil Howe, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Visatone (Australia)
results.brief_description: Canberra, the national capital of Australia, has a man-made lake in the centre of the city. We see a working model of the lake, dam, flood-gates, various transport routes and bridges. The lake, designed by Walter Burley Griffin, was opened at the end of 1964. Shows the official opening and the use of the lake for water sports.

results.title: Canadian profile
results.creator_credit: Allan Wargon, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An informal portrait of the people of Canada at a time when modern technology is reaching into every phase of national life. Beginning with the fishermen of Newfoundland and ending with the Kitimat project on the west coast, the film explores the demands of a new machine age on people of diverse origins in whom the feeling for tradition is strong. In all there is evidence of change, adjustment, adaption as the industrial expansion becomes increasingly accelerated. Award: Toronto

results.title: Canadian landscape
results.creator_credit: F.R. Crawley, National Film Board of Canada and Ottawa Film Unit
results.brief_description: A study of the characteristic style of A.Y. Jackson, one of Canada’s foremost modern painters. Jackson learned to select the more characteristic forms in his subject and underline their dominant tones and shapes. He first made small sketches on wooden panels which formed a basis for the larger compositions on canvas which were executed later in the studio. The film accurately describes the scenes of rural Quebec in winter and spring, and of northern Ontario in summer and autumn.

results.title: The Canadian air connection
results.creator_credit: Douglas Cameron, Colin Low, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film made for the Canadian Armed Forces that shows how refuelling is done in mid-air when it is necessary to send smaller airplanes on long missions.

results.title: Canada's Provinces and people
results.brief_description: Canada, a country with a great variety of landforms and people of many ethnic backgrounds, is emerging as a leader in world trade and has become one of the most prosperous nations of the world. Emphasises the relation of Canada’s natural resources to the lives of the people. Individual regions are mapped with their primary industries.

results.title: Canada's prairie Provinces
results.brief_description: A revealing look at Canada’s heartland. Traditional occupations of wheat farming, cattle raising and lumbering are shown with new occupations created by technology. Harnessing of rivers has brought irrigation and electric power for manufacturing. New industries plus discovery of oil, uranium and other minerals are changing life in the Prairie Provinces.
